result.execSummary:
The defendant David G Shepard II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber and good time allowed. Eligible for community service under 973.03.

Jail time can be served in another county, ultimate decision is up to sheriff's departments.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David G Shepard II

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Miller Carroll in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:13 PM. State here for final pre trial and not sure if the offer has been accepted. Carroll indicates he is unaware of where client is and would like to wait a few minutes. Court explains ramifications if offer is not accepted. Carroll requests a JT date to just be set. Bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am. Re-called on the record 1:36 PM. David Shepard now appears in person with his Attorney John Miller Carroll. State - they have come to an agreement. Accepting alternative offer and defendant will enter NC/G plea to count 1 with $500 fine plus costs, 30 days in FC jail and asks for time to report to allow transfer, count 2 would be DRI, has complied with victim notification and has provided defense - witness statement. Carroll and Shepard agree. Court DRI count 2. Shepard pleads NC to count 1. Court has plea questionnaire and goes over form with defendant, finds he is entering his plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently and waiving constitutional rights, finds factual basis, adjudges guilty to count 1. State makes final statement and asks to follow recommendation. Carroll makes final statement and asks to follow joint recommendation. Shepard makes statement, remorseful. Court accepts joint recommendation and sentences to the following: Count 1 - $500 fine plus costs, 60 DTP/CO and 30 days in FC jail, huber and good time allowed, eligible for community service under 973.03, no objection to serving in another county, ultimate decision of sheriff's in each county, must report on or before 4/8/16 at 8:30 AM. Must submit DNA sample. Carroll asks if DNA surcharge has to be assessed, court will accept his request as his DNA objection, can file motion hearing if need be for DNA surcharge. Right to appeal. Adjourned 1:49 PM

ADDRESS INFO for David G Shepard II
Current: 1284 Stead Drive, Menasha, WI 54952 United States  (Effective: 02-09-2016)
Prior: 15436 State Highway 32, Lakewood, WI 54138

Attorney John Miller Carroll in court.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:06 PM. Carroll has an auth to appear. Court finds it is appropriate. Carroll pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, no contact with Shayne Frank.

Defendant David G Shepard in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:43 AM. Shepard has complaint. Court reads charges, pentalties and right to an attorney. Shepard understands charges and would like an attorney, will hire his own. Court advises of SPD or court appointed attorney. State asks for $1000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, no contact with Shayne Frank. Court - $1000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, no contact with Shayne Frank.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.
